name: Microtel Inn & Suites by Wyndham Atlanta/Perimeter Center

reviews.text: As I entered the door, I could feel the warmth coming through the lobby. The hotel rep. Sophia was a comfort in my time of need. I am grateful for her excellent customer service.
reviews.title: A Very Warm Welcome and a Place of Comfort

reviews.text: Thank you
reviews.title: We loved the Microtel, Will definitly return....

reviews.text: I stayed at the Microtel for 4 weeks on business and the manager was generous enough to give me a long term discount. During the stay the staff made freshly baked chocolate chip cookies Every night. They were great! The pool was nice, the staff and the manager made me feel at home. I would definitly recommend this property.
reviews.title: Perfect for cheap solo business travel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I got a really good deal at this hotel and had a coupon. I made my decision based entirely on the fact that the pool got sun late in the day since I was in a class during the day. The location is close to the mall, restaurants, train, and a major business campus (King and Queen Buildings). It is lower end, but really has everything you need for a solo business traveler. The room was tiny, but that's what Microtel means. It was fine for me. It would have been way too small if my husband had come with me (like a cruise ship cabin). They do have suites, I just didn't need one. Has a microwave and fridge and free continental breakfast. The lighting was really bad for reading, studying, etc. I would say it was like a hospital room, but It also has a full wall of mirrors! The TV kind of teeters on top of the wardrobe and there is a window seat area. The AC was good, and there was iron, ironing board, and a hairdryer. The bed was really comfortable as are the pillows. The "business center" computer was very slow and the thermostat was broken in that room so it was hot. Workout room ok. It is a non-smoking hotel, but you can smoke outside. The pool had algae the first couple of days (but it was August in Georgia), then they cleaned it. Front desk was always nice and let me have a late checkout, so I could take my test and then come back and get my stuff out of the room. I felt it was perfect for my purposes and I was able to spend time at the pool in the afternoon. It is in a safe area with good restaurants nearby. I was comfortable walking in the area. Overall, it was really a value.
reviews.title: Pleasant surprise cut above the average Microtel

reviews.text: Was very pleased with this hotel, Continental breakfast vas good and the pool was very nice. Location was great, just a few minutes from all the shopping and may great eateries. Will be back to this one again.
reviews.title: Really nice staff, great hotel for business stay

reviews.text: I stay at this hotel alot for business visits to this area. Customer service here is Great every time and rooms are always Very clean with everything you would need. For the good prices they offer, I think they are well above the competition. I always enjoy the stay and they always take care of me.
reviews.title: Very Pleasant experience
Small, but clean room.
reviews.text: Summary: A nice clean hotel with small rooms and a basic breakfast, but perfect for a stopover.
Location: About 5-10 miles from downtown, and just off the Interstate. We were staying there as a stopover to another destination, and it was easy to find, and to get away from.
reviews.title: Great Southern Hospitality Receptionist (Shae)

reviews.text: Room: Nice and clean. We had a ground floor room. It's the smallest room we have had during our month in America, there is space to have a suitcase next to the bed (on all three sides), but not enough space to walk around it. The bathroom was a decent size (with a bathtub) and average for other hotels we have stayed in. There was an (old-school) CRT TV in the room with a limited number of TV channels (no E! or Bravo for the wife!!).
reviews.title: Receptionist (Shae) / Room

reviews.text: Cleanliness: Very clean. The bathroom, bedroom and the publuc areas were spotless.
reviews.title: Very Surprised

reviews.text: This hotel is located in a nice area of town on the Atlanta perimeter. Area is quiet. Room was functionally appointed; small but perfectly fine for 2 people. The price is great - probably the least expensive hotel in the area. Perfect for an overnight stay.
reviews.title: Good inexpensive hotel

reviews.text: Very nice neighborhood. Hotel was very clean, and the staff was friendly. Only problem we had was not enought towels. We were traveling with our son, stayed in a suite, but they would only leave us 2 towels instead of 3, and there were no sheets for the sofa bed. Minor problem that the front desk quickly took care of. We will definately be staying here again.
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.text: Stay here when in town on business, sometimes I jump around from place to place from high end to low end,but I ALWAYS, come back and no matter what the staff here " CUSTOMER SERVICE IS THE STAR" Rooms are very clean as well as the common areas, now if only they had better television selection that would have gotten them a 5 rating. For the price really not bad and it is very quiet which is great when you are conducting business calls. This is a great place for business travellers.
reviews.title: Awesome Staff

reviews.text: We had a good overnight stay. It has a nice appearence inside and outside. It is in a nice area, although a little hidden and you have to look for it a little to find it but it is not too bad. The bathroom could have been cleaner and the desk chair was dirty. The only problem we had was being by the ice machine and dealing with that noise. The breakfast selection was adequate but a little sparse and had very limited seating. I would stay there again.
reviews.title: OK Stay

reviews.text: My stay at the Microtel was incredible. The room was clean, the halls pleasant and the bed was so comfortable I didn't want to get up to start my day. And just let me say the price was right and oh, so worth it.
reviews.title: Great Night's Sleep

reviews.text: I stayed here on New Years Eve. I just needed a bed and a bath. I chose this place because it was dirt cheap for Atlanta on 12/31. Hotel was clean, rooms are small, staff was nice, bed was comfortable and it was quiet. I'd stay here again but not for longer than 1 night. Breakfast was very limited: Frozen sausage and biscuits (microwavable), 1 flavor of muffin, 1 flavor of bagel, hard boiled eggs, cereal, coffee and juice.
reviews.title: Place to crash on New Years' Eve

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: NOT one of the best hotels in the area. This location has 4 hotels within a close perimeter (like side by side). We just wanted a place to stay near downtown ATL to watch the Peach drop for New Years. Anyways here's the scoop:

reviews.text: Location: Always a great location, near a lot of restaurants, interstate, malls, and shopping areas.
reviews.title: Chicago to Orlando, second stop in Atlanta, GA

reviews.text: Price: reasonable
reviews.title: Let's Do It Again...

reviews.text: The Staff: did not seem happy at all. was not greeted upon entering the hotel. Basically the first attendant just asked us for our names. Did not smile, did not welcome us to the hotel, and did not event tell us about the room we were staying in. Just handed us the keys and told us the check out times. When we checked out, met another staff same predicament no greeting, just held out his hand for the hotel keys. He had a lip ring (which I think is unprofessional to have facial jewelry at work). We he answered the phone he just stated "front desk" not even the hotel name. We he handed us our receipt that was it, no "have a great day/ How was your stay?/ or come again".
reviews.title: 3's a Charm
